Articles.Content:
Subj.

No, this smiley guy had no chance to get out from under the canard. Not even with his jetpack
Looks like he is suffering a bad case of canarditis

Now that you mention it, his head DOES seem a little large for the cockpit.

That's a very stylish canard he's wearing, though. I want three of them.
You need a missile to shoot at him. He might not survive but aleast he will get out! And it's Kerbal!

Send a rescue pilot to get in the cockpit and fly the plane around in sharp pitches until the stuck guy falls out. That's what the fire department would do. I saw it on Emergency once. Of course, he'll likely fall to his death, but at least he won't be stuck anymore.

By the way, this is not an uncommon occurence.
Are those engines on? I feel like I am watching KSP's iteration of Wall-E.

Are those engines on?
In mine? That was an early EVA experiment to see if a pilot could survive bailing out of a plane by descending on suit RCS. Answer: no. The plane was under power and the airflow shoved the pilot between the fuselage and engine as they flexed apart while vibrating. (Ouch!) By the time he vibrated loose again, they were descending at a considerable rate. In the few seconds left before impact, I doubt any RCS alteration to his velocity could have been measured. Splat. Science marches on.

I had a Mun tower with a traversable inside, only one of my Kerbals fell in a gap and got his head stuck. I just took another kerbal out of the command module and started jumping on the head of the other, that worked!
this game is so ridiculous at times. i love it.
Man, that tiny seaplane is just what I've been looking for. Would you mind posting a craft file?
